nodes.bodyText: do we need to push the new image up everytime we call this script, note that the caller will require the user account password for fwnetworking for this to succeed.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,17 @@
+#!/bin/bash
+
+if $1; then
+	docker build -t fwnetworking/controller .
+	docker push fwnetworking/controller:latest

nodes.bodyText: Correct. We have an input parameter to determine whether to use this block or not.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,17 @@
+#!/bin/bash
+
+if $1; then
+	docker build -t fwnetworking/controller .
+	docker push fwnetworking/controller:latest

nodes.bodyText: +1. suggest to have the versioning config asap, to avoid using latest.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,17 @@
+#!/bin/bash
+
+if $1; then
+	docker build -t fwnetworking/controller .
+	docker push fwnetworking/controller:latest

nodes.bodyText: Better to have version tag here to avoid using latest.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,23 @@
+apiVersion: apps/v1
+kind: Deployment
+metadata:
+  name: alcor
+  labels:
+    app: alcor
+spec:
+  replicas: 3
+  selector:
+    matchLabels:
+      app: alcor
+  template:
+    metadata:
+      labels:
+        app: alcor
+    spec:
+      containers:
+        - name: alcor
+          image: fwnetworking/controller

nodes.bodyText: Thank you for the comment. A new version tag is added.
